helpItems:
Add-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsDataSource
Adds a data source to a Data Lake Analytics account.
Add AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsDataSource
The AzureRmDataLackAnalyticsDataSource cmdlet adds a data source to an Azure Data Lake Analytics account.
Add-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsDataSource
AccountName
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.
String
AzureBlob
Specifies the name of the Azure Blob Storage account to add.
String
AccessKey
Specifies the access key of the Azure Blob storage account to add.
String
ResourceGroupName
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.
String
Add-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsDataSource
AccountName
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.
String
DataLake
Specifies the name of the Azure Data Lake Store account to add.
String
Default
Indicates that the data source is the new default data source for the Data Lake Analytics account.
ResourceGroupName
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.
String
AccessKey
Specifies the access key of the Azure Blob storage account to add.
String
String
none
AccountName
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.
String
String
none
AzureBlob
Specifies the name of the Azure Blob Storage account to add.
String
String
none
DataLake
Specifies the name of the Azure Data Lake Store account to add.
String
String
none
Default
Indicates that the data source is the new default data source for the Data Lake Analytics account.
SwitchParameter
SwitchParameter
none
ResourceGroupName
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.
String
String
none
Example 1: Add a data source to an account
PS C:\> Add-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsDataSource -AccountName ContosoAdlA ` -DataLake ContosoAdlS
This command adds a Data Lake Store data source to a Data Lake Analytics account.
Remove-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsDataSource
Set-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsDataSource
Get-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount
Gets information about a Data Lake Analytics account.
Get AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount
The Get-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount cmdlet gets information about an Azure Data Lake Analytics account.
Get-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount
Name
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Analytics account.
String
ResourceGroupName
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.
String

ResourceGroupName
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.
String
Name
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Analytics account.
String
String
none
ResourceGroupName
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.
String
String
none
Example 1: Get information about a Data Lake Analytics account
PS C:\> Get-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount -AccountName "ContosoAdlAccount"
The following command gets information about the account named ContosoAdlAccount.
Set-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount
Get-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsCatalogItem
Get information about a specified Data Lake Analytics catalog item, or lists catalog items of a specified type.
Get AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsCatalogItem
The Get-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsCatalogItem gets information about a specified Azure Data Lake Analytics catalog item, or lists catalog items of a specified type.
Get-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsCatalogItem
AccountName
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.
String
ItemType
Specifies the catalog item type of the item(s) being fetched or listed. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Database -- Schema -- Assembly -- Table -- TableValuedFunction -- TableStatistics -- ExternalDataSource
Database Schema Assembly Table TableValuedFunction TableStatistics ExternalDataSource
Path
Specifies the multi-part path to the item to retrieve, or to the parent item of the items to list. The parts of the path should be separated by a period (.).
CatalogPathInstance
ResourceGroupName
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.
String
AccountName
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.
String
String
none
ItemType
Specifies the catalog item type of the item(s) being fetched or listed. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Database -- Schema -- Assembly -- Table -- TableValuedFunction -- TableStatistics -- ExternalDataSource
DataLakeAnalyticsEnums+CatalogItemType
DataLakeAnalyticsEnums+CatalogItemType
none
Path
Specifies the multi-part path to the item to retrieve, or to the parent item of the items to list. The parts of the path should be separated by a period (.).
CatalogPathInstance
CatalogPathInstance
none
ResourceGroupName
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.
String
String
none
Example 1: Get a specified database
PS C:\> Get-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsCatalogItem -AccountName contosoadla ` -ItemType Database ` -Path "databaseName"
This command gets the specified database.
Example 2: List tables within a specified database and schema
PS C:\> Add-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsDataSource -AccountName contosoadla ` -ItemType Table ` -Path "databaseName.schemaName"
This command gets a list of tables within a specified database.
Get-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJob
Retrieves information about a specified Data Lake Analytics job or a list of jobs.
Get AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJob
The Get-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJob cmdlet gets information about an Azure Data Lake Analytics job. If no job is specified, this cmdlet gets a list of jobs.
Get-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJob
AccountName
The Data Lake Analytics account name.
String
Name
Specifies a name to use to filter the job list results. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- None -- DebugInfo -- Statistics -- All
String
Submitter
Specifies the email address of a user. Use this parameter to filter the job list results to jobs submitted by a specified user.
String
ResourceGroupName
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.
String
SubmittedAfter
Specifies a date filter. Use this parameter to filter the job list result to jobs submitted after the specified date.
DateTimeOffset
SubmittedBefore
Specifies a date filter. Use this parameter to filter the job list result to jobs submitted before the specified date.
DateTimeOffset
State
Specifies a state filter for the job list results. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Accepted -- New -- Compiling -- Scheduling -- Queued -- Starting -- Paused -- Running -- Ended
JobState[]
Result
Specifies a result filter for the job list results. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- None -- Cancelled -- Failed -- Succeeded
JobResult[]
Get-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJob
AccountName
The Data Lake Analytics account name.
String
JobId
Specifies the job ID of the job to fetch.
Guid
Include
Specifies options that indicate the type of additional information to retrieve about the job. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- None -- DebugInfo -- Statistics -- All
None All DebugInfo Statistics
ResourceGroupName
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.
String
AccountName

String

none

-- None -- DebugInfo -- Statistics -- All

-- None -- DebugInfo -- Statistics -- All

String
none

Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.
String
String
none
Result
Specifies a result filter for the job list results. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- None -- Cancelled -- Failed -- Succeeded
JobResult[]
JobResult[]
none

Specifies a state filter for the job list results. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Accepted -- New -- Compiling -- Scheduling -- Queued -- Starting -- Paused -- Running -- Ended
JobState[]

none
SubmittedAfter
Specifies a date filter. Use this parameter to filter the job list result to jobs submitted after the specified date.

Submitter

String
String
none
Example 1: Get a specified job
PS C:\> Get-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJob -AccountName contosoadla ` -JobId $JobID01
The following command gets the job with the specified ID.
Example 2: Get jobs submitted in the past week
PS C:\> Get-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJob -AccountName contosoadla ` -SubmittedAfter (Get-Date).AddDays(-7)
The following command gets jobs submitted in the past week.
Stop-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJob
Submit-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJob
Wait-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJob
New-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount
Creates a new Data Lake Analytics account.
New AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount
The New-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount cmdlet creates a new Azure Data Lake Analytics account.
New-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount
ResourceGroupName
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account. To create a resource group, use the New-AzureRmResourceGroup cmdlet.
String
Name
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.
String
Location
Specifies the location at which to create the Data Lake Analytics account. Only East US 2 is supported at this time.
North Central US South Central US Central US West Europe North Europe West US East US East US 2 Japan East Japan West Brazil South Southeast Asia East Asia Australia East Australia Southeast
DefaultDataLake
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account to set as the default data source.
String
Tags
Specifies key-value pairs that can be used to identify the Data Lake Analytics account among other Azure resources.
Hashtable
DefaultDataLake
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account to set as the default data source.
String
String
none
Location
Specifies the location at which to create the Data Lake Analytics account. Only East US 2 is supported at this time.
String
String
none
Name
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.
String
String
none
ResourceGroupName
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account. To create a resource group, use the New-AzureRmResourceGroup cmdlet.
String
String
none
Tags
Specifies key-value pairs that can be used to identify the Data Lake Analytics account among other Azure resources.
Hashtable
Hashtable
none
Example 1: Create a Data Lake Analytics account
PS C:\> New-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount -Name "ContosoAdlAccount" ` -ResourceGroupName "ContosoOrg" ` -Location "East US 2" ` -DefaultDataLake ContosoAdlStore `
This command creates a Data Lake Analytics account named ContosoAdlAccount that uses the ContosoAdlStore Data Store, in the resource group named ContosoOrg.
Get-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount
Set-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount
Test-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount
New-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsCatalogSecret
Creates a new Azure Data Lake Analytics catalog secret.
New AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsCatalogSecret
The New-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsCatalogSecret cmdlet creates a new secret to use in an Azure Data Lake Analytics catalog.
New-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsCatalogSecret
AccountName

String
DatabaseName
Specifies the name of the database that holds the secret.
String
Secret
Specifies the name and password of the secret.
PSCredential
Host
Specifies the host name for the secret.
String
ResourceGroupName
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.
String
Port
Specifies the port number of the secret.
Int32

Example 1: Get the secret for a catalog
PS C:\> New-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsCatalogSecret -AccountName "ContosoAdlAccount" ` -DatabaseName "databaseName" ` -Secret (Get-Credential) ` -Host "https://example.contoso.com" -Port 8080
This command gets the secret corresponding to the specified account, database, credential and host.

Remove-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount
Deletes a Data Lake Analytics account.
Remove AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount
The Remove-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount cmdlet deletes an Azure Data Lake Analytics account permanently.
Remove-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount
Name
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.
String
ResourceGroupName
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.
String
Force
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
PassThru
Indicates that the cmdlet does not wait for the operation to complete. Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Force
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
SwitchParameter
SwitchParameter
none

Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.
String

none

SwitchParameter
SwitchParameter
none
ResourceGroupName
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.
String
String
none
Example 1: Remove an account
PS C:\> Remove-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount -Name "ContosoAdlAccount"
The following command removes the specified Data Lake Analytics account.

Remove-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsDataSource
Removes a data source from a Data Lake Analytics account.
Remove AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsDataSource
The Remove-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsDataSource cmdlet removes a data source from an Azure Data Lake Analytics account.
Remove-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsDataSource

Example 1: Remove a data source
PS C:\> Remove-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsDataSource -AccountName "ContosoAdlAccount" ` -AzureBlob "AzureStorage01"
This command removes the data source named AzureStorage01 from the account named ContosoAdlAccount.
Add-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsDataSource
Set-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsDataSource
The cmdlets in the Azure Data Lake Analytics module enable you to manage HDInsight clusters and the jobs that run on them. The cmdlets exist in the Microsoft.Azure.Commands.DataLakeAnalytics namespace.
Azure PowerShell is a command-line shell and scripting language designed to help information technology (IT) professionals automate system administration tasks. To install the latest Azure PowerShell version and associate it with your Azure subscription, see How to install and configure Azure PowerShell. For more information about Azure Resource Manager cmdlets, see Using Azure PowerShell with Azure Resource Manager.
The following table contains links to the topics for the Azure Data Lake Analytics Cmdlets:
Name
Description
Add-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsDataSource
Adds a data source to a Data Lake Analytics account.
Get-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount
Gets information about a Data Lake Analytics account.
Get-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsCatalogItemGet-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsCatalogItem
Get details of a specific catalog item, or list catalog items of a given type in a Data Lake Analytics account.
Get-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJob
Retrieves information about a specified job or a list of jobs in a Data Lake Analytics account.
New-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount
Creates a new Data Lake Analytics account.
New-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsCatalogSecret
Creates a new Data Lake Analytics catalog secret.
Remove-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount
Deletes a Data Lake Analytics account.
Remove-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsCatalogSecret
Deletes a Data Lake Analytics catalog secret.
Remove-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsDataSource
Removes a data source from a Data Lake Analytics account.
Set-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount
Modifies a Data Lake Analytics account.
Set-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsCatalogSecret
Modifies a Data Lake Analytics catalog secret.
Set-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsDataSource
Modifies a data source in a Data Lake Analytics account.
Stop-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJob
Cancels a Data Lake Analytics job.
Submit-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJob
Submits a Data Lake Analytics job.
Test-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount
Checks for the existence of a Data Lake Analytics account.
Test-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsCatalogItem
Checks for the existence of a Data Lake Analytics catalog item.
Wait-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJob
Waits for a Data Lake Analytics job to complete.
For more information about, or for the syntax of, any of the cmdlets, use the Get-Help <cmdlet name> cmdlet, where <cmdlet name> is the name of the cmdlet that you want to research. For more detailed information, you can run any of the following cmdlets: ● Get-Help <cmdlet name> -Detailed ● Get-Help <cmdlet name> -Examples ● Get-Help <cmdlet name> -Full Azure Resource Manager CmdletsAzure Cmdlet ReferenceSet-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount
Modifies a Data Lake Analytics account.
SetAzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount
The Set-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount cmdlet modifies an Azure Data Lake Analytics account.Set-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccountName
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.StringDefaultDataLake
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account to set as the default data source.StringTags
Specifies key-value pairs that can be used to identify the Data Lake Analytics account among other Azure resources.HashtableResourceGroupName
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.StringDefaultDataLake
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account to set as the default data source.StringStringnoneName
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.StringStringnoneResourceGroupName
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.StringStringnoneTags
Specifies key-value pairs that can be used to identify the Data Lake Analytics account among other Azure resources.HashtableHashtablenone
Example 1: Modify the data source of an account
PS C:\> Set-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount -Name "ContosoAdlAcct" ` -DefaultDataLake "ContosoAdlStore01" ` -Tags @{"stage"="production"}
This command changes the default data source and the Tags property of the account.

Exampl1: Modify the secret associated with an account
PS C:\> Set-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsCatalogSecret -AccountName "ContosoAdlAccount" ` -DatabaseName "databaseName" ` -Secret (Get-Credential) ` -Host "https://example.contoso.com" -Port 8080
This command sets the secret associated with a Data Lake Analytics catalog.

Example 1: Change the access key for a data source
PS C:\> Set-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsDataSource -AccountName "ContosoAdlAccount" ` -AzureBlob contosowasb -AccessKey "...newaccesskey..."
This command changes the access key stored for an Azure Blob Storage data source.

Cancels a job.
StopAzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJob
The Stop-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJob cmdlet cancels an Azure Data Lake Analytics job.Stop-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJobAccountName
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.StringJobId
Specifies the ID of the job to cancel.GuidResourceGroupName
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.StringForce
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.PassThru

Example 1: Cancel a job
PS C:\> Stop-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJob -AccountName "ContosoAdlAccout" -JobId "a0a78d72-3fa8-4564-9b18-6becb3fda48a"
This command cancels the job with the specified ID.
Get-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJobSubmit-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJobWait-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJobSubmit-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJob
Submits a job.
SubmitAzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJob
The Submit-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJob cmdlet submits an Azure Data Lake Analytics job.Submit-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJobAccountName
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.StringName
Specifies the job name.StringScriptPath
Specifies the local file path to the script to run.StringRuntime
Specifies the runtime version of the job.StringCompileMode
Specifies the compilation mode of the job. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Semantic -- Full -- SingleBox SemanticFullSingleBoxCompileOnly
Indicates that this cmdlet compiles the job without running it.DegreeOfParallelism
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics Units (DLAU) of the job, which indicates the maximum allowable parallelism of the job.Int32Priority
Specifies the priority of the job. If not specified, the priority is 1000. A lower the number indicates a higher job priority.Int32ResourceGroupName
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.StringSubmit-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJobAccountName
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.StringName
Specifies the job name.StringScript
Specifies the contents of the script to run.StringRuntime
Specifies the runtime version of the job.StringCompileMode
Specifies the compilation mode of the job. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Semantic -- Full -- SingleBox SemanticFullSingleBoxCompileOnly
Indicates that this cmdlet compiles the job without running it.DegreeOfParallelism
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics Units (DLAU) of the job, which indicates the maximum allowable parallelism of the job.Int32Priority
Specifies the priority of the job. If not specified, the priority is 1000. A lower the number indicates a higher job priority.Int32ResourceGroupName
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.StringAccountName
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.StringStringnoneCompileMode
Specifies the compilation mode of the job. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Semantic -- Full -- SingleBox StringStringnoneCompileOnly
Indicates that this cmdlet compiles the job without running it.SwitchParameterSwitchParameternoneDegreeOfParallelism
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics Units (DLAU) of the job, which indicates the maximum allowable parallelism of the job.Int32Int32noneName
Specifies the job name.StringStringnonePriority
Specifies the priority of the job. If not specified, the priority is 1000. A lower the number indicates a higher job priority.Int32Int32noneResourceGroupName
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.StringStringnoneRuntime
Specifies the runtime version of the job.StringStringnoneScript
Specifies the contents of the script to run.StringStringnoneScriptPath
Specifies the local file path to the script to run.StringStringnone
Example 1: Submit a job
PS C:\> Submit-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJob -AccountName "ContosoAdlAccount" ` -Name "New Job" -ScriptPath $localScriptPath ` -DegreeOfParallelism 32
This command submits a Data Lake Analytics job.
Get-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJobStop-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJobWait-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJobTest-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount
Checks for the existence of a Data Lake Analytics account.
TestAzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount
The Test-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount cmdlet checks for the existence of a Data Lake Analytics account.Test-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccountName
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.StringResourceGroupName
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.StringName
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.StringStringnoneResourceGroupName
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.StringStringnone
Example 1: Test whether an account exists
PS C:\> Test-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount -AccountName "ContosoAdlAccount"
This command tests whether the account named ContosoAdlAccount exists.
Get-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccountNew-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccountSet-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccountTest-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsCatalogItem
Checks for the existence of a catalog item.
TestAzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsCatalogItem
The Test-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsCatalogItem cmdlet checks for the existence of an Azure Data Lake Analytics catalog item.Test-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsCatalogItemAccountName
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.StringItemType
Specifies the catalog item type of the item to check. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Database -- Schema -- Assembly -- Table -- TableValuedFunction -- TableStatistics -- ExternalDataSourceDatabaseSchemaAssemblyTableTableValuedFunctionTableStatisticsExternalDataSourcePath
Specifies the path to the item to fetch, or the path to the parent item of the items to list.CatalogPathInstanceResourceGroupName
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.StringAccountName
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.StringStringnoneItemType
Specifies the catalog item type of the item to check. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Database -- Schema -- Assembly -- Table -- TableValuedFunction -- TableStatistics -- ExternalDataSourceDataLakeAnalyticsEnums+CatalogItemTypeDataLakeAnalyticsEnums+CatalogItemTypenonePath
Specifies the path to the item to fetch, or the path to the parent item of the items to list.CatalogPathInstanceCatalogPathInstancenoneResourceGroupName
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.StringStringnone
Example 1: Test whether a catalog item exists
PS C:\> Test-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsCatalogItem -AccountName "ContosoAdlAccount"` -ItemType Schema -Path "databaseName.schemaName"
This command tests whether a specified Schema item exists.
Get-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsCatalogItemWait-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJob
Waits for a job to complete.
WaitAzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJob
The Wait-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJob cmdlet waits for an Azure Data Lake Analytics job to complete.Wait-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJobAccountName
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.StringJobId
Specifies the ID of the job for which to wait.GuidWaitIntervalInSeconds
Specify the number of seconds that elapse between each check of the job state.Int32TimeoutInSeconds
Specifies the number of seconds to wait before exiting the wait operation.Int32ResourceGroupName
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.StringAccountName
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.StringStringnoneJobId
Specifies the ID of the job for which to wait.GuidGuidnoneResourceGroupName
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.StringStringnoneTimeoutInSeconds
Specifies the number of seconds to wait before exiting the wait operation.Int32Int32noneWaitIntervalInSeconds
Specify the number of seconds that elapse between each check of the job state.Int32Int32none
Example 1: Wait for a job to complete
PS C:\> Wait-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJob -AccountName "ContosoAdlAccount" -JobId "a0a78d72-3fa8-4564-9b18-6becb3fda48a"
The following command waits for the job with the specified ID to complete.
Get-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJobStop-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJobSubmit-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJob
